- Becomes the First Lady of the United States.
Launches the national campaign, "Let's Move!," to reduce childhood obesity.
Travels to Africa for a week to focus on youth leadership, education, health and wellness.
Visits former president of South Africa Nelson Mandela at his home.
The Story of the White House Kitchen Garden and Gardens Across America" is published.
Presents the Academy Award for best picture at the Oscars.
Along with other high profile celebrities and politicians, Obama's financial information is hacked and posted online.
Her student loan information and credit report are posted.
Is on the cover of April's edition of Vogue.
This is the second time she has appeared on the cover.
The First Lady hosts the soon-to-be first lady, Melania Trump, for tea and a tour of the White House residence, Press Secretary Josh Earnest says in a White House briefing.
Is on the cover of December's edition of Vogue.
This is the third time she has appeared on the cover.
Gives her final White House remarks thanking her supporters and saying, "being your first lady has been the greatest honor of my life and I hope I've made you proud."
Remarks that "any woman who voted against Hillary Clinton voted against their own voice" during an appearance at the Inbound 2017 conference in Boston.
